stories.storyText:
[Code Name] Ayerscarpe
[Gender] Male
[Combat Experience] 1 Year
[Place of Birth] RIM Billiton
[Date of Birth] Oct 25
[Race] Cautus
[Height] 173cm
[Infection Status] 
Medical tests have confirmed that no infection is present.

[Physical Strength] Standard
[Mobility] Excellent
[Physical Resilience] Excellent
[Tactical Acumen] Standard
[Combat Skill] Excellent
[Originium Arts Assimilation] Standard

Bodyguard to the Catastrophe Messenger Leonhardt, coming with him to Rhodes Island. He brings his experience in escorting, investigation, guerilla warfare, and infiltration under complex conditions. 
He enters the battlefield with an unconventional weapon purchased from Rim Billiton's black market and can provide a variety of short and medium-range attacks for his squad, exterminating enemies as his only means of protecting important targets.

Imaging tests reveal clear, normal outlines of internal organs, and no abnormal shadows have been detected. Originium granules have not been detected in the circulatory system and there is no sign of infection. At this time, this operator is believed to be uninfected. 

[Cell-Originium Assimilation] 0%
Only scars and abdominal markings are visible, with no signs of infection. 

[Blood Originium-Crystal Density] 0.07u/L
Remnants of Originium are visible on organs but at very low concentrations. 

'That golden-haired Cautus must have provided this guy with a bit of his own protective Arts. Otherwise, he would've turned into ash long ago given the kind of work environments mentioned in his file.' —A not very polite Medic
'Abdominal area feels pretty good on palpation.' —Medic's addendum

Before joining Rhodes Island, Ayerscarpe was the bodyguard to Leonhardt, a Catastrophe Messenger. His main job was to protect Leonhardt from harm during his investigations and assessments of Catastrophes. Combined with Leonhardt's cleverness, the duo rarely run into sticky situations. Most of the time, Ayerscarpe only needs to accompany him on walks, help carry equipment, or listen to his friend's incessantly prattling about what he thinks is cool — at least until the moment when a crisis comes and he is required to perform his duties.
There are many ways for a bodyguard to protect his target. Some people prefer using defensive measures to mitigate the damage, others are good at arranging traps to deter an enemy's attack. However, Ayerscarpe's preferred method of defense is to eradicate the enemies. Though he is a man of few words, his ferocious attacks indeed confirm his status as an operator who believes that the best defense is a good offense.

Ayerscarpe's chosen method of defense is extremely risky and does not conform to the logic of ordinary people. However, the operator himself is well-suited for carrying out his duties in this manner. In addition to having excellent combat skills and rapid reaction times, part of this operator's success is owed to the special weapon that he carries. 
There has been no official name given to this weapon as of yet, and the nicknames that the operator himself has chosen, such as 'my baby,' or 'nice guy,' have no reference value whatsoever. Due to the operating mode of the weapon itself, we've temporarily named it 'RT-01.' 
Since there is no weapon or even weapon class similar to RT-01 within our scope of knowledge, we believe that this is an experimental weapon. According to Ayerscape, this weapon was purchased from Rim Billiton's black market. Rim Billiton has developed many small-scale private mining companies due to its robust mining industry. The turnover and conglomeration rate among these companies are high, which indirectly promotes the black market. Many resources will circulate here before eventually reaching the hands of private individuals, organizations, or even foreign forces. Because Ayerscarpe overcame great difficulties to acquire this weapon, and the weapon itself boasts excellent performance, he is extremely fond of RT-01. When asked to describe any deficiencies, he'll only point out that it 'produces some slight noise from time to time.' 
The operator in charge of weapon inspections said he didn't hear anything, but Ayerscarpe insists that he hears it loud and clear.

Ayerscarpe and Leonhardt have been friends since childhood, and the two also divide labor amongst each other very cleanly. Leonhardt takes on jobs that require negotiation or involve minerals, and Ayerscarpe takes on tasks that require superior athleticism or uncovering things that can't be discovered by others. Don't be fooled by the fact that he often exchanges harsh words with his old friend — he will never make Leonhardt look bad in front of others, and if something ever happens to him, he is the first to rush over. When Leonhardt became a Catastrophe Messenger, Ayerscarpe volunteered to become Leonhardt's private bodyguard. Since Ayerscarpe acquired his unique set of weapons, it would be more profitable to take on jobs of his own rather than protecting the Catastrophe Messenger, but Ayerscarpe stubbornly insists on remaining his friend's bodyguard, while also making it clear that the other party needs to pay up. All in all, Leonhard, not wealthy in the first place, ended up allocating most of his salary to Ayerscarpe, ending up in an even tighter financial situation as a result. 
Although we didn't know how Ayerscarpe controlled these funds before, we were able to investigate the flow of funds between the two after he became an operator, and the results were mind-blowing. 
Leonhardt's concept of managing money is rather laissez-faire. While he is good at making money, he's also good at spending it. After joining Rhodes Island, his shopping list grew longer than ever due to stable living arrangements and a higher salary. Except for work-related tools such as dune buggies, which have questionable usability in general circumstances, Leonhardt's stash of new and interesting things has indeed been growing. Most of these items simply reflect his personal taste, but others are for gifting to young operators who he deems to 'not be cool enough,' and he often offers these gifts in a way that is hard to refuse. Sometimes, his consumption habits have caused been problematic, such as when he couldn't pay the bills one time. This time, he has had Ayerscarpe to cover for him.
Ayerscarpe's lifestyle has always been very frugal. Other than spending money on necessary living expenses and salted edamame, Ayerscarpe has been saving his money, and he basically returns the 'payment' he received from serving as Leonhardt's bodyguard to his friend at the right time. He knows that Leonhardt doesn't know how to save money, and he knows that sooner or later, he wouldn't be able to purchase something that he actually needed. At that time, he'll use that money to buy things for his friend and send it over to him. Even now when there is no direct financial connection between the two, he still often draws from his savings to fill in the gap for Leonhardt. Of course, he also knows that Leonhardt will repay him in due time. This is the mutual understanding formed after many years of cooperation, and demonstrates the trust between the two friends.

'We found a signal transmitter on Ayerscarpe's weapon, which has already been dismantled, that the operator had no knowledge of.' 
'The signal sent from the transmitter automatically searches for a valid port, performs a second transmission, before eliminating all traces until it reaches the target.' 
'Most countries' military-grade communications equipment does not have this level of technology.' 
'After cracking the transmission path of the launcher and simulating a transmission, we have reason to believe—'
'It's Rhine Lab. I can tell just from looking at it.' 
'The signal's final destination is a port located in Ursus.' 
'After being intercepted by a node halfway through, it modified the target port before immediately deleting the data. This is an old trick.' 
'Do you really think Ursus knows how to make a weapon like this?' 
'A reloading blade-gun, a self-calibrating gun, automatic hover blades.' 
'Only Rhine Labs has the capacity to deliberately integrate these technologies into a single system.' 
'I see.' 
'So——'
'How did a Columbian experimental weapon end up in Rim Billiton, in the hands of a young man who has nothing to do with them?' 
'......'
This whole situation has Rhine Lab's fingerprints all over it. Let me give you a hypothetical.' 
'Sure.' 
'On Terra, there will always be people with extraordinary talents.' 
'It is a joy to craft weapons for them.' 
'When these weapons are manufactured and their wielders seem to possess all the power in the world within their hands, buyers will arrive in droves to snag up these weapons.' 
'In the hands of ordinary people, these 'divine' weapons are not even as useful as a logging hatchet.' 
'As for what Rhine Labs did, I actually have an idea.' 
'They designed a 'divine weapon,' but realized that it is nothing but a hatchet.' 
'This thing?' 
'This is a failed design.' 
'While the design seems well-integrated as a whole, the Originium undergoes serious leakage problems during conversion, and the accuracy of the hovering blades is unsatisfactory.' 
'If not in the hands of someone who has a hobby of getting electrocuted, this weapon is not usable at all.' 
'How do we deal with this then?' 
'Deal with? There's no need for that. Saria couldn't see eye-to-eye about the way certain departments in Rhine Lab did things, but she wouldn't do anything about these weapon owners.' 
'Our biggest fear is that Rhine Lab will use the signal transmitter to take control of the device and do something unspeakable.' 
'Since we found out about it, it should be fine now that we've destroyed it.' 
'As for what Rhine Lab will do with the data they obtained, will they find another target to experiment upon, or will they create the hatchet that can slay a god?' 
'So, what does this have to do with Rhodes Island?' 
—Unknown time, Rhodes Island, unidentified surveillance recording

Ayerscarpe is a very strange person. 
Even though I know that we shouldn't be quick to judge others, he really is a strange person. 
For example, take his habit of eating salted edamame. 
I know some people who think food from the East is new and exotic and have a desire to try it, and sometimes they'll even really like it. 
But I cannot understand his particular way of eating. 
He eats them, shell and everything. 
He just pops the entire pod into his mouth. 
I didn't know either at first, and originally thought that was how you were supposed to eat them. I gave it a try, and thought that these were inedible, and decided that whoever came up with the idea of eating these things must've been crazy. 
But then, someone told me to peel the pod. 
Ayerscarpe even made a little box to take with him that is specifically for edamame, which he probably eats as a snack. 
As for why, I can't don't why. 
Oh, right, there's one other thing. The guy thinks he runs on electricity. 
I'm serious. 
I have no idea if his weapon electrocutes people, but when I see his ears tremble, I'm pretty sure there's some electricity involved. 
What's more, he always goes around asking those electricity-based operators if he can bum some electricity from them. 
I'm talking Greyy, that guy who fixes the electrical outlets, and Leizi. 
He walked up to Leizi like a plank one day and asked, 'is there some way for me to quickly increase the charge my body can carry?' 
Is he stupid?! 
I feel even worse for that little Victorian hairstylist. They already have to deal with getting shocked by static electricity all the time due to their Oripathy, but now there's this guy who's always asking, 'Can you shock me real quick?' Absolute maniac! 
————A certain file manager's evaluation in the appendix

skins.description:
An outfit commonly worn by Operators.
While not as practical as a uniform, it's what they find most comfortable.

An outfit that has been improved after the Operator's Promotion.
Custom-made to suit each Operator's experiences and needs, these outfits are designed to provide them maximum flexibility on any battlefield. Furthermore, this is all done without compromising the comfort that they've come to expect.

<color name=#ffffff>Bloodline of Combat Collection/Tested One. Ayerscarpe's attire while upgrading the Rim Billiton Weapon Distribution Center weapons system. He needs to infiltrate a Catastrophe area together with his friends, and heist an important piece of data back before the Columbians.</color>

skills.desc: The next attack deals <@ba.vup>{atk_scale:0%}</> ATK as Arts damage to up to <@ba.vup>{max_target}</> enemies within range and <$ba.sluggish>Slows</> them for <@ba.vup>{sluggish:0.0}</> second(s)

Range <@ba.vup>expands</>; Damage type changes to Arts Damage; Each attack deals an additional <@ba.vup>{atk_scale:0%}</> of ATK as Arts damage to all enemies blocked by friendly Operators in the surrounding 8 tiles (this damage is treated as a melee attack)

modules.desc:
Operator Ayerscarpe has demonstrated a remarkable aptitude for wide-range enemy suppression.
The Field Operations Department has thus passed the following resolution:
This operator shall be appointed a Guard Operator during field operations to exercise Lord responsibilities.
In witness whereof,
This badge is hereby conferred upon the above named.

<Portable Wildland Stimulant: Preparation, Instruction and Efficacy>
[Preparation and Instruction]
1. Prepare some cooked edamame. Do not salt or peel them.
2. Prepare a device to freeze the edamame. I will use my own edamame box here as a demonstration: this much freezing is just right.
3. Prepare a device to discharge electricity. I'll demonstrate with my trusty sidekick here: this much power leakage is just right.
4. Lower the voltage of the discharge device and shock the edamame until the juice inside carries a slight charge.
5. Eat.
[Efficacy]
In the barrens, maintaining a clear mind can be a real challenge. The boundless wilderness, the sweeping dust storms, the glow reflecting from the active Originium clouds in the sky, the howl of the wind blowing through Originium crystal clusters... It's easy to gradually lose your sense of self and fall into a trance-like state where you won't notice incoming dangers.
Chew the edamame along with its shell. The hairs of the shell can stimulate the mouth, thus keeping the user's nerves active.
Frozen edamame can stimulate the gums and make it easier to stay awake.
The slightly-charged juices can give a tingling jolt, thus sharpening the user's perception.
Proper stimulation can prevent people from falling into a stupor. This is the only way to survive in the wilderness.

'You've put a weird amount of thought into this manual, Ayers.'
'Quit flapping your gums, Leon. A lot of operators have been coming by the last few days, asking me for the secret to staying awake in the wilds. I'm sick of giving the same explanation again and again.'
'I guess it's true that your manual could stop people from coming, but... to be honest, I'm surprised those hobbies of yours can actually come in handy.'
'That's a nice bonus. Edamame is delicious, and I find the electric jolt refreshing.'
'Well, whatever floats your boat. At first, I was worried you were forcing yourself to do all that just to stay awake protecting me...'
'Do I seem like that kind of person?'
'Not really. Remember the first time you ate edamame? With shell and everything? You didn't know to peel it back then and we were worried it'd cause some sort of problem, but instead you seemed happy as could be.'
'I remember. That was when the mining ship broke down in the barrens. By the time we got it huffing and puffing to the next mine, everyone was already delirious with hunger. It was the first time I had food that could just snap you back to your senses, and it really stuck with me.'
'Wait, so it all comes back to waking you up after all? You know, I'm starting to feel a little sorry for you, Ayers.'
'No, it's because edamame is delicious, and I find the electric jolt refreshing.'
'...Alright then. Whatever floats your boat.'

voice_lines.voiceText: Before you leave, I am responsible for protecting you.
Doctor, I'm looking for a way to quickly increase the charge my body can carry. Look for an operator who uses electricity? That makes sense, I'll try it.
Go to Leonhardt if you need ore identified. I'm no good at this.
The boss lady of Rhine Lab frowned when she saw me, as if I was some kind of pest. What a pain. When did I ever do anything to her?
My ears are standing up? Don't worry, *bzzt*, it's just the static, and it actually feels pretty good. It'll, *bzzt*, come down on its own after a while.

It took me two years of scrouging and going into debt to buy this baby. If not for its value, the Cautus profiteers on the black market would've thrown me away onto some mining ship. The fact that I can have a comfortable life today is all due to this little electricity-leaking guy.
Oh, there you are. How about a fresh, chilled piece of salted edamame? Don't want it? You've gotta learn to appreciate this kind of food. Here, eat it.

Leonhardt's too noisy and causes too much trouble. I prefer hanging out with you. What? He got surrounded by the Medical Department staff for pulling too many pranks on them? He just doesn't know what's pushing it too far, and I don't think he's ever going to learn. Tsk, I'm going to take a look. Doctor, want to come with me if you're free?

I protect Wright because we've been together ever since we were little. Something happens to him, I pay it back, and vice versa. But as for us, we haven't had such a long and stable relationship. Don't think you can get close to me just because you helped bandage my wounds, got it? ...I said the same thing last time? Tsk, damn it.
Huh?! Oh... it's you. It's nothing, I'm just lying here to recuperate. If you want to rest as well, I'll make space for you.
Catastrophe Messenger bodyguard, Ayerscarpe. Pleased to meet you.
Very professional. Worth learning from.
Haven't I been getting overpaid recently? A promotion? Oh, I see. Thank you.
Being a bodyguard is not about defense, but rather control. Control the space around the target and eliminate all threats. Shall I prove it to you?
Squad joined, awaiting deployment.
Begin the operation at your own pace.
No abnormal changes detected. The squad can begin moving.
Target located. Move out!
Ah.
Awaiting your command.
Device, activate.
Let's get to work.
It's over!
Your life is mine!
The best defense is a good offense.
There is no winning or losing. Only life or death.
Good job controlling the entire situation. Hmph. Congratulations.
We made good time. We should get going.
I'm willing to believe that letting that person through was part of your plans.
Don't worry about my injuries. Just make sure you get back safely.
I'll leave the arrangements to you. I have no demands.
Don't touch my ears.
You look troubled. What's on your mind?
Arknights.

I can think of a flashy Cautus who'll go out today to sing and dance, then pass out somewhere. Yeah… about time he crashed out. I'll go pick him up and then head off to sleep. See you around, Doctor. Happy New Year.
Is there something you need?

Here, salted edamame. What are you looking at? You think I shelled them for you? I eat pre-shelled ones sometimes, too. It's a different texture... Why do I still eat entire pods? Just a force of habit. Get to eating yours. Happy birthday.

I've saved up quite a bit of money this year. Since coming to Rhodes Island, Leon and I have more stable incomes. He hasn't said anything, but it's a while since I got him anything. No point letting the money sit there. What should I buy? Doctor, do you have any suggestions?

building_skills.desc: When this Operator is assigned to the Reception Room, Clue search speed increases by <@cc.vup>10%</>
When this Operator is assigned to the Reception Room, Clue search speed increases by <@cc.vup>20%</>
